win32
Class GuiAutomation

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--win32.GuiAutomation
public class GuiAutomation
extends java.lang.Object

Port of the winGuiAuto.py libraries. Provides a set of utility methods for interacting with Win32 applications.

Method Detail

getWindowsVersion

public static int getWindowsVersion()
Returns a constant code for the version of Windows running.

findTopWindow

public static int findTopWindow(java.lang.String wantedText,
                                java.lang.String wantedClass,
                                win32.SelectionFunction selectionFunction)
                         throws GuiAutomationException
Find the hwnd of a top level window. You can identify windows using captions, classes, a custom selection function, or any combination of these. (Multiple selection criteria are ANDed. If this isn't what's wanted, use a selection function.)

Parameters:
wantedText - Text which required windows' captions must contain.
wantedClass - Class to which required windows must belong.
selectionFunction - Filter for the returned windows. May be null in which case no filter is applied.
Returns:
The hwnd of the first top window which matches the given criteria.
GuiAutomationException

findTopWindows

public static java.util.List findTopWindows(java.lang.String wantedText,
                                            java.lang.String wantedClass,
                                            win32.SelectionFunction selectionFunction)
                                     throws GuiAutomationException
Find the hwnd of top level windows. You can identify windows using captions, classes, a custom selection function, or any combination of these. (Multiple selection criteria are ANDed. If this isn't what's wanted, use a selection function.)

Parameters:
wantedText - Text which required windows' captions must contain.
wantedClass - Class to which required windows must belong.
selectionFunction - Filter for the returned windows. May be null in which case no filter is applied.
Returns:
A list containing the window handles of all top level windows matching the supplied selection criteria.
Throws:
GuiAutomationException

dumpWindow

public static java.util.List dumpWindow(int hwnd)
Dump all controls from a window into a nested list. Useful during development, allowing to you discover the structure of the contents of a window, showing the text and class of all contained controls.

Parameters:
hwnd - The window handle of the top level window to dump.
Returns:
A nested list of Window objects for all of the window's children.

findControl

public static int findControl(int topHwnd,
                              java.lang.String wantedText,
                              java.lang.String wantedClass,
                              win32.SelectionFunction selectionFunction)
                       throws GuiAutomationException
Find a control. You can identify a control using caption, classe, a custom selection function, or any combination of these. (Multiple selection criteria are ANDed. If this isn't what's wanted, use a selection function.)

Parameters:
topHwnd - The window handle of the top level window in which the required controls reside.
wantedText - Text which the required control's captions must contain.
wantedClass - Class to which the required control must belong.
selectionFunction - Filter for the returned windows. May be null in which case no filter is applied.
Returns:
The window handle of the first control matching the supplied selection criteria.
Throws:
GuiAutomationException

findControls

public static java.util.List findControls(int topHwnd,
                                          java.lang.String wantedText,
                                          java.lang.String wantedClass,
                                          win32.SelectionFunction selectionFunction)
                                   throws GuiAutomationException
Find controls. You can identify controls using captions, classes, a custom selection function, or any combination of these. (Multiple selection criteria are ANDed. If this isn't what's wanted, use a selection function.)

Parameters:
topHwnd - The window handle of the top level window in which the required controls reside.
wantedText - Text which the required controls' captions must contain.
wantedClass - Class to which the required controls must belong.
selectionFunction - Filter for the returned windows. May be null in which case no filter is applied.
Returns:
A list of the window handles of the controls matching the supplied selection criteria.
Throws:
GuiAutomationException

getTopMenu

public static int getTopMenu(int hwnd)
                      throws GuiAutomationException
Get a window's main, top level menu.

Parameters:
hwnd - The window handle of the top level window for which the top level menu is required.
Returns:
The menu handle of the window's main, top level menu.
GuiAutomationException

activateMenuItem

public static void activateMenuItem(int hwnd,
                                    java.util.List menuItemPath)
                             throws GuiAutomationException
Activate a menu item.

Parameters:
hwnd - The window handle of the top level window whose menu you wish to activate.
menuItemPath - The path to the required menu item. This should be a sequence specifying the path through the menu to the required item. Each item in this path can be specified either as an index, or as a menu name.
GuiAutomationException

getMenuInfo

                                   int itemIndex)
Get various info about a menu item.

Parameters:
hMenu - The menu in which the item is to be found.
itemIndex - The item's index
Returns:
Menu item information object.

getEditText

public static java.util.List getEditText(int hwnd)
Returns the text in an edit control.

Parameters:
hwnd - Window handle for the edit control.
Returns:
List of text lines in the edit control.

setEditText

public static void setEditText(int hwnd,
                               java.lang.String text,
                               boolean append)
Set an edit control's text.

Parameters:
hwnd - The edit control's hwnd.
text - The new value for the control's text.
append - true if the text should be appended and otherwise it will replace the existing text.

setEditText

public static void setEditText(int hwnd,
                               java.util.List text,
                               boolean append)
Set an edit control's text.

Parameters:
hwnd - The edit control's hwnd.
text - List of Strings. Each element will become a seperate line in the control.
append - true if the text should be appended and otherwise it will replace the existing text.
